alternatives.transcript: The first ten people represent everyone in America from the poorest 10% to the very richest 10%. Most Americans pay multiple income taxes. If adding up all the income taxes, the data shows that poor people pay a very small part of their income to the government. And rich people pay more. This phenomenon is called progressive taxation. However, if we consider another special group, the 400 billionaires, who are the richest Americas. They don’t make most of their money through typical income. So their income actually gets taxed at relatively lower rates. Furthermore, there are many other kinds of taxes in America, such as property taxes, estate taxes, payroll taxes, and consumption taxes. When we put these taxes together, we see that America’s tax system as a whole is not very progressive. Instead, it’s mostly flat. And the 400 billionaires are paying a smaller portion than everyone else.
